# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString; text_width::Int=10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    for word in split(text)
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        current_line *= word * " "
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
text = "Hello there, how are you today? This is a very long sentence that should wrap."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, text_width=20)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This function splits the input text into words and iterates over them. It builds a new line by appending each word to the current line until the maximum width is reached. Once the limit is exceeded, it starts a new line and continues building from there. After processing all the words, it joins the lines back together with newline characters in between, creating a wrapped version of the original text.
